scenarioDescription:
The HD 3167 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 3167 is a star with 0.94 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.87 times its radius. It is located 154.24 light years away from the solar system.

HD 3167 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 3167 system


HD 3167 b

HD 3167 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 3167 b is 5.021 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 3167 b is 1.700 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 3167 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 3167 c

HD 3167 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2016-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 3167 c is 9.804 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 3167 c is 2.860 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 3167 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 3167 d

HD 3167 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2017-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 3167 d is 6.904 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 3167 d is 2.520 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 3167 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 3167, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: HD 3167 - System With 3 Exolanets
